values.description:
The gazebo_dart_2.1 branch is ready to merge into gazebo_2.2 (pull request #850), but it is a more complicated merge to default due to conflicts and some new API's that must be implemented. This pull request will fix all problems with a merge to default.

The branch gazebo_dart could be merged directly to default, but it would be difficult to see the changed code, so I created the branch default_gazebo_dart_2.1 in 4fbb6b0 by:
~~~
hg pull
hg up default
hg branch default_gazebo_dart_2.1
hg merge gazebo_dart_2.1
~~~
and then resolving conflicts in Server.hh and Joint_TEST.cc.

Once this pull request is approved, I will merge pull request #850 to gazebo_2.2, then merge default_gazebo_dart_2.1 to default.
values.title: Prepare for gazebo_dart_2.1 to merge to default

summary.raw:
The gazebo_dart_2.1 branch is ready to merge into gazebo_2.2 (pull request #850), but it is a more complicated merge to default due to conflicts and some new API's that must be implemented. This pull request will fix all problems with a merge to default.

The branch gazebo_dart could be merged directly to default, but it would be difficult to see the changed code, so I created the branch default_gazebo_dart_2.1 in 4fbb6b0 by:
~~~
hg pull
hg up default
hg branch default_gazebo_dart_2.1
hg merge gazebo_dart_2.1
~~~
and then resolving conflicts in Server.hh and Joint_TEST.cc.

Once this pull request is approved, I will merge pull request #850 to gazebo_2.2, then merge default_gazebo_dart_2.1 to default.
summary.html:
The gazebo_dart_2.1 branch is ready to merge into gazebo_2.2 (pull request #850), but it is a more complicated merge to default due to conflicts and some new API's that must be implemented. This pull request will fix all problems with a merge to default.

The branch gazebo_dart could be merged directly to default, but it would be difficult to see the changed code, so I created the branch default_gazebo_dart_2.1 in 4fbb6b0 by:

hg pull
hg up default
hg branch default_gazebo_dart_2.1
hg merge gazebo_dart_2.1

and then resolving conflicts in Server.hh and Joint_TEST.cc.

Once this pull request is approved, I will merge pull request #850 to gazebo_2.2, then merge default_gazebo_dart_2.1 to default.

values.description:
Fix cmake uninstall script to handle install prefixes with spaces in the folder names (discovered during [simbody pull request 106](https://github.com/simbody/simbody/pull/106)). This is fixed by putting `\"` around the file name in the remove command.

I also fixed some minor syntax warnings that were printed:
~~~
Argument not separated from preceding token by whitespace.
~~~
values.title: Fix uninstall script to handle folder names with spaces

summary.raw:
Fix cmake uninstall script to handle install prefixes with spaces in the folder names (discovered during [simbody pull request 106](https://github.com/simbody/simbody/pull/106)). This is fixed by putting `\"` around the file name in the remove command.

I also fixed some minor syntax warnings that were printed:
~~~
Argument not separated from preceding token by whitespace.
~~~
summary.html:
Fix cmake uninstall script to handle install prefixes with spaces in the folder names (discovered during simbody pull request 106). This is fixed by putting \" around the file name in the remove command.

I also fixed some minor syntax warnings that were printed:

Argument not separated from preceding token by whitespace.

values.description:
While debugging the problem with log and jenkins I found that there is no check on response of log file creating. This should help to show the problem when it happens. 

Update: for the failing test, it should be enough to check if log directory exists, and if does not, create it.
values.title: Check the correct opening of log file. Fix test. (->2.2)

summary.raw:
While debugging the problem with log and jenkins I found that there is no check on response of log file creating. This should help to show the problem when it happens. 

Update: for the failing test, it should be enough to check if log directory exists, and if does not, create it.
summary.html:
While debugging the problem with log and jenkins I found that there is no check on response of log file creating. This should help to show the problem when it happens.

Update: for the failing test, it should be enough to check if log directory exists, and if does not, create it.

values.description:
As part of the works to properly implement visibility on gazebo, this first PR tries to handle the embedded opende copy we had under deps/ directory.

As of now, we were generating 4 shared libraries which are not really being used anywhere more than in gazebo_physics_ode. Since they are a fork of the official ode libraries I would prefer no to re-distribute them (libs and headers) if possible.

The approach here is to change them to be static and statically linked them into gazebo_physics_ode and not to install all related headers files. 

After this first step, we will be able to define as ```GAZEBO_VISIBLE``` the functions on ```gazebo/physics/ode``` and all symbols from our ode fork will keep not exported, which I believe is a good thing to do. 

I was able to compile, install and run drcsim on top of these changes.
values.title: Convert opende libraries to be static and not installed (->default)

summary.raw:
As part of the works to properly implement visibility on gazebo, this first PR tries to handle the embedded opende copy we had under deps/ directory.

As of now, we were generating 4 shared libraries which are not really being used anywhere more than in gazebo_physics_ode. Since they are a fork of the official ode libraries I would prefer no to re-distribute them (libs and headers) if possible.

The approach here is to change them to be static and statically linked them into gazebo_physics_ode and not to install all related headers files. 

After this first step, we will be able to define as ```GAZEBO_VISIBLE``` the functions on ```gazebo/physics/ode``` and all symbols from our ode fork will keep not exported, which I believe is a good thing to do. 

I was able to compile, install and run drcsim on top of these changes.
summary.html:
As part of the works to properly implement visibility on gazebo, this first PR tries to handle the embedded opende copy we had under deps/ directory.

As of now, we were generating 4 shared libraries which are not really being used anywhere more than in gazebo_physics_ode. Since they are a fork of the official ode libraries I would prefer no to re-distribute them (libs and headers) if possible.

The approach here is to change them to be static and statically linked them into gazebo_physics_ode and not to install all related headers files.

After this first step, we will be able to define as GAZEBO_VISIBLE the functions on gazebo/physics/ode and all symbols from our ode fork will keep not exported, which I believe is a good thing to do.

I was able to compile, install and run drcsim on top of these changes.

values.description:
The joint classes inconsistently used integers and unsigned integers when referring to a joint axis. 

This pull request changes all functions to use unsigned int.
values.title: Use unsigned integers to reference joint axis

summary.raw:
The joint classes inconsistently used integers and unsigned integers when referring to a joint axis. 

This pull request changes all functions to use unsigned int.
summary.html:
The joint classes inconsistently used integers and unsigned integers when referring to a joint axis.

This pull request changes all functions to use unsigned int.

values.description:
Full information in issue #1007. Summary:

* Do not assume that qreal type is a double. In fact, in ARM is a float.
* Use PIC to generate code for static libraries that will join a shared library.

Thanks to @rmattes for all the work.
values.title: Fixes to compile gazebo in the ARM platform

summary.raw:
Full information in issue #1007. Summary:

* Do not assume that qreal type is a double. In fact, in ARM is a float.
* Use PIC to generate code for static libraries that will join a shared library.

Thanks to @rmattes for all the work.
summary.html:
Full information in issue #1007. Summary:

  • Do not assume that qreal type is a double. In fact, in ARM is a float.
  • Use PIC to generate code for static libraries that will join a shared library.

Thanks to @rmattes for all the work.

values.description:
Many of our regression tests fail during teardown, but it is not always easy to tell when this occurs. I'm adding a `gzdbg` message at the beginning of `ServerFixture::Unload` so it's easier to see when tests are failing during teardown.

Also, long ago I did the math wrong when calculating ServerFixture load time.
values.title: Improve ServerFixture console messages

summary.raw:
Many of our regression tests fail during teardown, but it is not always easy to tell when this occurs. I'm adding a `gzdbg` message at the beginning of `ServerFixture::Unload` so it's easier to see when tests are failing during teardown.

Also, long ago I did the math wrong when calculating ServerFixture load time.
summary.html:
Many of our regression tests fail during teardown, but it is not always easy to tell when this occurs. I'm adding a gzdbg message at the beginning of ServerFixture::Unload so it's easier to see when tests are failing during teardown.

Also, long ago I did the math wrong when calculating ServerFixture load time.

values.description: The Joint_TEST file is getting big and prone to conflicts. This pull request moves some of the tests into two separate integration tests, one related to force-torque and one related to spawning joints. I'm leaving Joint_TEST.hh in place for the time being since it provides some useful joint spawning functions that are used by other tests.
values.title: Split tests out of UNIT_Joint_TEST

summary.raw: The Joint_TEST file is getting big and prone to conflicts. This pull request moves some of the tests into two separate integration tests, one related to force-torque and one related to spawning joints. I'm leaving Joint_TEST.hh in place for the time being since it provides some useful joint spawning functions that are used by other tests.

This pull request moves some of the tests into two separate integration tests, one related to force-torque and one related to spawning joints. I'm leaving Joint_TEST.hh in place for the time being since it provides some useful joint spawning functions that are used by other tests.

values.title: Update to 2014 copyright

values.description:
There's some [Jenkins tests failing](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-default-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/482/testReport/) due to an assertion:
~~~
105: [ RUN      ] NoiseTest.ApplyGaussian
105: ***** Internal Program Error - assertion (noise->GetNoiseType() == Noise::GAUSSIAN || noise->GetNoiseType() == Noise::GAUSSIAN_QUANTIZED) failed in static gazebo::sensors::NoisePtr gazebo::sensors::NoiseFactory::NewNoiseModel(sdf::ElementPtr, const string&):
105: /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/gazebo-default-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/gazebo/gazebo/sensors/Noise.cc(50): Noise type should be 'gaussian' or 'gaussian_quantized'
105/128 Test #105: UNIT_Noise_TEST ........................***Exception: Other  2.55 sec
~~~
I followed a backtrace to instances of the GaussianNoiseModel class, which wasn't setting its `Noise::type` value.
values.title: Specify type in GaussianNoiseModel to fix failing tests

summary.raw:
There's some [Jenkins tests failing](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-default-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/482/testReport/) due to an assertion:
~~~
105: [ RUN      ] NoiseTest.ApplyGaussian
105: ***** Internal Program Error - assertion (noise->GetNoiseType() == Noise::GAUSSIAN || noise->GetNoiseType() == Noise::GAUSSIAN_QUANTIZED) failed in static gazebo::sensors::NoisePtr gazebo::sensors::NoiseFactory::NewNoiseModel(sdf::ElementPtr, const string&):
105: /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/gazebo-default-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/gazebo/gazebo/sensors/Noise.cc(50): Noise type should be 'gaussian' or 'gaussian_quantized'
105/128 Test #105: UNIT_Noise_TEST ........................***Exception: Other  2.55 sec
~~~
I followed a backtrace to instances of the GaussianNoiseModel class, which wasn't setting its `Noise::type` value.
summary.html:
There's some Jenkins tests failing due to an assertion:

105: [ RUN      ] NoiseTest.ApplyGaussian
105: ***** Internal Program Error - assertion (noise->GetNoiseType() == Noise::GAUSSIAN || noise->GetNoiseType() == Noise::GAUSSIAN_QUANTIZED) failed in static gazebo::sensors::NoisePtr gazebo::sensors::NoiseFactory::NewNoiseModel(sdf::ElementPtr, const string&):
105: /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/gazebo-default-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/gazebo/gazebo/sensors/Noise.cc(50): Noise type should be 'gaussian' or 'gaussian_quantized'
105/128 Test #105: UNIT_Noise_TEST ........................***Exception: Other  2.55 sec

I followed a backtrace to instances of the GaussianNoiseModel class, which wasn't setting its Noise::type value.

values.description: This is a workaround for plugin loading on OSX (#800), autoreplace `.so` with `.dylib`. There is a fair bit of discussion on #800 on how to do this the right way. In the meantime, this workaround will be helpful to Gazebo users with OSX.

summary.raw: This is a workaround for plugin loading on OSX (#800), autoreplace `.so` with `.dylib`. There is a fair bit of discussion on #800 on how to do this the right way. In the meantime, this workaround will be helpful to Gazebo users with OSX.
summary.html: This is a workaround for plugin loading on OSX (#800), autoreplace .so with .dylib. There is a fair bit of discussion on #800 on how to do this the right way. In the meantime, this workaround will be helpful to Gazebo users with OSX.

values.description:
A follow-up to pull request #917 and pull request #924: there was a missing header in MeshCSG.cc that was missed by Jenkins because this file is only compiled when the GTS package is installed. Currently the default branch doesn't compile if GTS is installed.

UPDATE: I also included the header in GLWidget.cc since that has GZ_ASSERT calls but doesn't yet have the header.
values.title: One more Assert fix (#1019)

UPDATE: I also included the header in GLWidget.cc since that has GZ_ASSERT calls but doesn't yet have the header.

values.description:
This is in response to this [question](http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/5288/using-gazebo-as-a-physics-simulation-inside-a/), where the user wants to use gazebo as a library in their own main loop.

The API to make this happen was very ugly. This PR simplifies the process of setting up gazebo for use as a client or a server.

Running [ABI checker](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any_to_any-abichecker-quantal-amd64/52/)
values.title: Simplify the process of using gazebo as a library

The API to make this happen was very ugly. This PR simplifies the process of setting up gazebo for use as a client or a server.

Running [ABI checker](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any_to_any-abichecker-quantal-amd64/52/)
summary.html:
This is in response to this question, where the user wants to use gazebo as a library in their own main loop.

values.description:
How to test:

  1. Put an object in the world

  1. Rotate the object

  1. Lighting on the object should not look funny (ex: bright spot should not rotate).

The two test models are:

  1. Polaris ranger ev

  1. Robocup soccer ball
values.title: Some collada files rotate the normals.

values.description:
There are know problems with Qt on Mac retina displays. Here are gui style updates to get it to render correctly. These changes don't affect gzclient in ubuntu as they are the defaults, so they should appear exactly the same as before. 

- Fix toolbar icon size 

- Tab alignment

See [screenshot](https://www.dropbox.com/s/4yudknj9mui3b0z/gazebo_retina_gui.png) for before and after the change (the bottom one is the new gui with the joint controller panel manually dragged out)
values.title: Fix toolbar size and tab alignment

summary.raw:
There are know problems with Qt on Mac retina displays. Here are gui style updates to get it to render correctly. These changes don't affect gzclient in ubuntu as they are the defaults, so they should appear exactly the same as before. 

- Fix toolbar icon size 

- Tab alignment

See [screenshot](https://www.dropbox.com/s/4yudknj9mui3b0z/gazebo_retina_gui.png) for before and after the change (the bottom one is the new gui with the joint controller panel manually dragged out)
summary.html:
There are know problems with Qt on Mac retina displays. Here are gui style updates to get it to render correctly. These changes don't affect gzclient in ubuntu as they are the defaults, so they should appear exactly the same as before.

  • Fix toolbar icon size

  • Tab alignment

See screenshot for before and after the change (the bottom one is the new gui with the joint controller panel manually dragged out)

values.description:
I broke DART support in gazebo by merging pull request #891 today. The tests were passing when I first created the pull request, before dart support had merged into gazebo default. Since then new tests had been added, and I didn't run the test suite again.

This is a reason to run `make test` after every commit, even a merge with default.

I don't think this has generated any Jenkins failures yet, but I expect that it will.

EDIT: An explanation for the fix: we added the ability for each physics engine to make its own SurfaceParams type and required that they allocate it in their constructor. This was done for [SimbodyCollision in pull request 891](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/891/refactor-physics-surfaceparams-class-to/diff#chg-gazebo/physics/simbody/SimbodyCollision.cc) but not dart.
values.title: Fix dart by allocating surface variable

summary.raw:
I broke DART support in gazebo by merging pull request #891 today. The tests were passing when I first created the pull request, before dart support had merged into gazebo default. Since then new tests had been added, and I didn't run the test suite again.

This is a reason to run `make test` after every commit, even a merge with default.

I don't think this has generated any Jenkins failures yet, but I expect that it will.

EDIT: An explanation for the fix: we added the ability for each physics engine to make its own SurfaceParams type and required that they allocate it in their constructor. This was done for [SimbodyCollision in pull request 891](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/891/refactor-physics-surfaceparams-class-to/diff#chg-gazebo/physics/simbody/SimbodyCollision.cc) but not dart.
summary.html:
I broke DART support in gazebo by merging pull request #891 today. The tests were passing when I first created the pull request, before dart support had merged into gazebo default. Since then new tests had been added, and I didn't run the test suite again.

This is a reason to run make test after every commit, even a merge with default.

I don't think this has generated any Jenkins failures yet, but I expect that it will.

EDIT: An explanation for the fix: we added the ability for each physics engine to make its own SurfaceParams type and required that they allocate it in their constructor. This was done for SimbodyCollision in pull request 891 but not dart.

values.description:
This addresses several of @\_jrivero_ 's comments about pull request #891 (refactoring of SurfaceParams), which was recently merged. Additionally, I created a class in SurfaceParams to store the mu1 and mu2 variables, which are common to ODE and Bullet (maybe dart as well). This allows the bounds checking to be done in a single place.

I would classify this pull request as refactoring (similar to pull request #891). It's still on the todo list to make a test for the fdir1 parameter (#630) and fix friction for the other physics engines (#989, #1000).
values.title: Create FrictionPyramid class to generalize mu1, mu2, and fdir1 parameters

summary.raw:
This addresses several of @\_jrivero_ 's comments about pull request #891 (refactoring of SurfaceParams), which was recently merged. Additionally, I created a class in SurfaceParams to store the mu1 and mu2 variables, which are common to ODE and Bullet (maybe dart as well). This allows the bounds checking to be done in a single place.

I would classify this pull request as refactoring (similar to pull request #891). It's still on the todo list to make a test for the fdir1 parameter (#630) and fix friction for the other physics engines (#989, #1000).
summary.html:
This addresses several of @_jrivero_ 's comments about pull request #891 (refactoring of SurfaceParams), which was recently merged. Additionally, I created a class in SurfaceParams to store the mu1 and mu2 variables, which are common to ODE and Bullet (maybe dart as well). This allows the bounds checking to be done in a single place.

I would classify this pull request as refactoring (similar to pull request #891). It's still on the todo list to make a test for the fdir1 parameter (#630) and fix friction for the other physics engines (#989, #1000).

values.description:
We have some cool examples, but they tend to get out of date. I've created a regression test that builds several example plugins that are used in gazebo tutorials. My grand plan (#951) is to include the example code in the gazebo wiki directly from bitbucket, to reduce copy and paste errors and also ensure that the examples on the wiki are regression tested.

I've fixed four broken example plugins in this pull request. It is easy to add tests for new plugins (see example_plugins.cc), but I will save that for one of our testing parties.

UPDATE: I updated the test file to use the gtest machinery for parameterized tests to make it a little more concise. Plugins can be added to the test by adding a single line.

EDIT: Most of the fixes for the examples were copied directly from the wiki. The wiki has seen much more maintenance than our examples folder.

UPDATE: The temporary build folders are now removed at the end of each test.
values.title: Create regression test that builds example plugins (part of #951)

I've fixed four broken example plugins in this pull request. It is easy to add tests for new plugins (see example_plugins.cc), but I will save that for one of our testing parties.

values.description:
Implement a test fixture [util.hh](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/new#chg-test/util.hh) which can be used by tests in order to start the log system using a name composed by: test_case + test_name. 

Use this fixture in all kind of unit tests. Some extra features were added to the Fixture, so [Console_TEST](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/update/939#chg-gazebo/common/Console_TEST.cc) can get rid of most of the duplicate code among test casese.

The final goal is to be able to export all log files in jenkins. An example of this working can be found in [this exportlog testing job](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-exportlog-precise-amd64/14/).
values.title: Issue #1002. Use a Fixture to generate proper log filenames in tests

Implement a test fixture [util.hh](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/new#chg-test/util.hh) which can be used by tests in order to start the log system using a name composed by: test_case + test_name. 

Use this fixture in all kind of unit tests. Some extra features were added to the Fixture, so [Console_TEST](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/update/939#chg-gazebo/common/Console_TEST.cc) can get rid of most of the duplicate code among test casese.

The final goal is to be able to export all log files in jenkins. An example of this working can be found in [this exportlog testing job](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-exportlog-precise-amd64/14/).
summary.html:
Implement a test fixture util.hh which can be used by tests in order to start the log system using a name composed by: test_case + test_name.

Use this fixture in all kind of unit tests. Some extra features were added to the Fixture, so Console_TEST can get rid of most of the duplicate code among test casese.

The final goal is to be able to export all log files in jenkins. An example of this working can be found in this exportlog testing job.

values.description:
Issue 1: Full screen anti-aliasing is broken in ogre < 1.8. The render texture will not update properly if fsaa is used.

Issue 2: Model shading was poor when using ModelPropShopPlugin to generate images. I added a light that moves to illuminate the model. This required a tweak the Light class.

Issue 3: Fix spelling in gzprop man page.

Issue 4: gzprop assumed `model.sdf` in the given model directory. The user must now specify the complete sdf file to use.

How to test:

1. $ gzprop <model_director/model.sdf>

1. Unpack the resulting tarball.

1. Check the images in `<model_name>/meta/`
 

Note that this is going into default because ThePropShop will not be available for use until Gazebo 3.0
values.title: Updates to propshop plugin and tweaks to rendering

summary.raw:
Issue 1: Full screen anti-aliasing is broken in ogre < 1.8. The render texture will not update properly if fsaa is used.

Issue 2: Model shading was poor when using ModelPropShopPlugin to generate images. I added a light that moves to illuminate the model. This required a tweak the Light class.

Issue 3: Fix spelling in gzprop man page.

Issue 4: gzprop assumed `model.sdf` in the given model directory. The user must now specify the complete sdf file to use.

How to test:

1. $ gzprop <model_director/model.sdf>

1. Unpack the resulting tarball.

1. Check the images in `<model_name>/meta/`
 

Note that this is going into default because ThePropShop will not be available for use until Gazebo 3.0
summary.html:
Issue 1: Full screen anti-aliasing is broken in ogre < 1.8. The render texture will not update properly if fsaa is used.

Issue 2: Model shading was poor when using ModelPropShopPlugin to generate images. I added a light that moves to illuminate the model. This required a tweak the Light class.

Issue 3: Fix spelling in gzprop man page.

Issue 4: gzprop assumed model.sdf in the given model directory. The user must now specify the complete sdf file to use.

How to test:

  1. $ gzprop <model_director/model.sdf>

  2. Unpack the resulting tarball.

  3. Check the images in <model_name>/meta/

Note that this is going into default because ThePropShop will not be available for use until Gazebo 3.0

values.description:
gazebo currently throws an exception when running  `sdf/worlds/sonar_demo.world` due to problems publishing collision visual msgs for the sonar sensor collision created in [SonarSensor.cc](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/853cdd857abe5cff3cfc188ff8e383a302f0d43a/gazebo/sensors/SonarSensor.cc?at=gazebo_2.2#cl-120)

Since the sonar sensor collision has the type `SENSOR_COLLISION` which is not really a physical collision object in the world, I just prevented its collision visual msg from being published.  

I can update the pull request to create and publish the sonar collision visual if that's the desired result.
values.title: Fix sonar sensor collision visual problem

summary.raw:
gazebo currently throws an exception when running  `sdf/worlds/sonar_demo.world` due to problems publishing collision visual msgs for the sonar sensor collision created in [SonarSensor.cc](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/853cdd857abe5cff3cfc188ff8e383a302f0d43a/gazebo/sensors/SonarSensor.cc?at=gazebo_2.2#cl-120)

Since the sonar sensor collision has the type `SENSOR_COLLISION` which is not really a physical collision object in the world, I just prevented its collision visual msg from being published.  

I can update the pull request to create and publish the sonar collision visual if that's the desired result.
summary.html:
gazebo currently throws an exception when running sdf/worlds/sonar_demo.world due to problems publishing collision visual msgs for the sonar sensor collision created in SonarSensor.cc

Since the sonar sensor collision has the type SENSOR_COLLISION which is not really a physical collision object in the world, I just prevented its collision visual msg from being published.

I can update the pull request to create and publish the sonar collision visual if that's the desired result.

values.description:
See issue #1030.

Some comments:

* Bug fixed in *gazebo/common/SystemPaths_TEST*: 

    *paths->GetGazeboPaths()* should be *paths->GetPluginPaths()*

* There are still references to */tmp* in some world files under *test/sdf/* .

    We can tackle this in a separate issue/pull request because it's probably an sdformat problem. Does it make sense?

summary.html:
See issue #1030.

Some comments:

  • Bug fixed in gazebo/common/SystemPaths_TEST:

    paths->GetGazeboPaths() should be paths->GetPluginPaths()

  • There are still references to /tmp in some world files under test/sdf/ .

    We can tackle this in a separate issue/pull request because it's probably an sdformat problem. Does it make sense?

values.description:
I introduced a race condition in the sonar sensor test in 717f9bc ([Jenkins test failure](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-gazebo_2.2-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/41/testReport/junit/%28root%29/SonarTests_SonarSensor_TEST/DemoWorld_0/)). It was expecting `sensor->GetRange()` would equal its max range (ie. it doesn't see anything). But there is an object in front of it that it will see given enough time. So it was a race to finish the test before the sonar sensor is fully initialized and making readings.

The fix is to force the world to take 100 steps so it will have time to see the object. I also noticed that the other physics engines don't support the sonar sensor (#1038).
values.title: Fix race condition in sonar test

summary.raw:
I introduced a race condition in the sonar sensor test in 717f9bc ([Jenkins test failure](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-gazebo_2.2-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/41/testReport/junit/%28root%29/SonarTests_SonarSensor_TEST/DemoWorld_0/)). It was expecting `sensor->GetRange()` would equal its max range (ie. it doesn't see anything). But there is an object in front of it that it will see given enough time. So it was a race to finish the test before the sonar sensor is fully initialized and making readings.

The fix is to force the world to take 100 steps so it will have time to see the object. I also noticed that the other physics engines don't support the sonar sensor (#1038).
summary.html:
I introduced a race condition in the sonar sensor test in 717f9bc (Jenkins test failure). It was expecting sensor->GetRange() would equal its max range (ie. it doesn't see anything). But there is an object in front of it that it will see given enough time. So it was a race to finish the test before the sonar sensor is fully initialized and making readings.

The fix is to force the world to take 100 steps so it will have time to see the object. I also noticed that the other physics engines don't support the sonar sensor (#1038).
